Key Match Events: India beat England by 68 runs in the final of the T20 World Cup 2024.
Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav were the main stars of the batting effort.
Axar Patel won the player of the match award for his 4-0-23-3 in Guyana.
Kuldeep Yadav completed a riveting spell of 4-0-19-3.
Kuldeep took 10 wickets from 4 matches in the tournament.
Axar Patel took 3 wickets in quick succession.
England lost 9 wickets in just 16.4 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: India are once again in a T20 World Cup semi-final after being hammered by England by 10 wickets in Adelaide in the last T20 World Cup.
Rohit Sharma's men have an opportunity to avenge that defeat as they face England.
There is no reserve day for today's game.
There is an additional 250 minutes for the game to be completed.
If rain abandons the game or forces a no-result, India will qualify for the final as they had more wins than England in the Super 8 stage.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli said it was a great effort from everyone and they adapted well to the conditions.
He backed Kohli for the final and said the team has been very calm as a unit.
Jos Buttler of England said India outplayed them and they let them get 20-25 runs too many.
He praised India's spinners and said they bowled above par.
Axar Patel said he had to bowl in the powerplay and the wicket was slow, so he tried to bowl slower.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India have reached the finals of three back to back ICC tournaments - WTC, ODI World Cup and now T20 World Cup.
